info.name: M3 v2.4 Asset Service final - Complete API Collection
info.description: Complete API collection for Asset Management Service with all controllers, environment variables, and body variables

request.description: Upload Excel file for bulk category creation
Upload a document for an entity

query.description: true for inline view, false for download

request.description: Download or view a file by filename

Link an ASSET to a user. Supports universal entity linking for ASSET, COMPONENT, MODEL, MAKE, AMC, WARRANTY, DOCUMENT.

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: Caller user ID ({{userId}})
- username: Caller username ({{username}})
- entityType: Entity type - ASSET, COMPONENT, MODEL, MAKE, AMC, WARRANTY, DOCUMENT
- entityId: ID of the entity to link (use {{assetId}}, {{componentId}}, etc.)
- targetUserId: Target user ID to link the entity to ({{targetUserId}})
- targetUsername: Target username ({{targetUsername}})

**Example Entity Types:**
- ASSET: Link an asset to a user
- COMPONENT: Link a component to a user
- MODEL: Link a model to a user
- MAKE: Link a make to a user
- AMC: Link an AMC to a user
- WARRANTY: Link a warranty to a user
- DOCUMENT: Link a document to a user
Link a COMPONENT to a user using the universal link endpoint.
Link a MODEL to a user using the universal link endpoint.
Link a MAKE to a user using the universal link endpoint.
Link an AMC to a user using the universal link endpoint.
Link a WARRANTY to a user using the universal link endpoint.
Link a DOCUMENT to a user using the universal link endpoint.

Delink an ASSET from a user. Supports universal entity delinking for ASSET, COMPONENT, MODEL, MAKE, AMC, WARRANTY, DOCUMENT.

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: Caller user ID ({{userId}})
- username: Caller username ({{username}})
- entityType: Entity type - ASSET, COMPONENT, MODEL, MAKE, AMC, WARRANTY, DOCUMENT
- entityId: ID of the entity to delink (use {{assetId}}, {{componentId}}, etc.)
- targetUserId: Target user ID to delink the entity from ({{targetUserId}})
- targetUsername: Target username ({{targetUsername}})

**Note:** The entity must be currently linked to the target user for delinking to succeed.
Delink a COMPONENT from a user using the universal delink endpoint.
Delink a MODEL from a user using the universal delink endpoint.
Delink a MAKE from a user using the universal delink endpoint.
Delink an AMC from a user using the universal delink endpoint.
Delink a WARRANTY from a user using the universal delink endpoint.
Delink a DOCUMENT from a user using the universal delink endpoint.

Link a user to multiple entities in a single request using typed fields.

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: Caller user ID ({{userId}})
- username: Caller username ({{username}})
- targetUserId: Target user ID to link entities to ({{targetUserId}})
- targetUsername: Target username ({{targetUsername}})
- assetId: Asset ID to link ({{assetId}})
- componentId: Component ID to link ({{componentId}})
- modelId: Model ID to link ({{modelId}})
- makeId: Make ID to link ({{makeId}})
- amcId: AMC ID to link ({{amcId}})
- warrantyId: Warranty ID to link ({{warrantyId}})
- documentId: Document ID to link ({{documentId}})

**Note:** All entity ID fields are optional. Provide only the IDs you want to link.

Link a user to multiple entities using the string format (backward compatible).

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: Caller user ID ({{userId}})
- username: Caller username ({{username}})
- targetUserId: Target user ID ({{targetUserId}})
- targetUsername: Target username ({{targetUsername}})
- entityLinks: Array of strings in format "TYPE:ID" (e.g., ["ASSET:1", "COMPONENT:2"])

**String Format Examples:**
- "ASSET:1001" - Link asset with ID 1001
- "COMPONENT:501" - Link component with ID 501
- "MODEL:201" - Link model with ID 201
- "MAKE:101" - Link make with ID 101
- "AMC:301" - Link AMC with ID 301
- "WARRANTY:401" - Link warranty with ID 401
- "DOCUMENT:701" - Link document with ID 701

Delink a user from multiple entities in a single request using typed fields.

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: Caller user ID ({{userId}})
- username: Caller username ({{username}})
- targetUserId: Target user ID to delink entities from ({{targetUserId}})
- targetUsername: Target username ({{targetUsername}})
- assetId: Asset ID to delink ({{assetId}})
- componentId: Component ID to delink ({{componentId}})
- modelId: Model ID to delink ({{modelId}})
- makeId: Make ID to delink ({{makeId}})
- amcId: AMC ID to delink ({{amcId}})
- warrantyId: Warranty ID to delink ({{warrantyId}})
- documentId: Document ID to delink ({{documentId}})

**Note:** All entity ID fields are optional. Provide only the IDs you want to delink.

Delink a user from multiple entities using the string format (backward compatible).

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: Caller user ID ({{userId}})
- username: Caller username ({{username}})
- targetUserId: Target user ID ({{targetUserId}})
- targetUsername: Target username ({{targetUsername}})
- entityLinks: Array of strings in format "TYPE:ID" (e.g., ["ASSET:1", "COMPONENT:2"])

**String Format Examples:**
- "ASSET:1001" - Delink asset with ID 1001
- "COMPONENT:501" - Delink component with ID 501
- "MODEL:201" - Delink model with ID 201
- "MAKE:101" - Delink make with ID 101
- "AMC:301" - Delink AMC with ID 301
- "WARRANTY:401" - Delink warranty with ID 401
- "DOCUMENT:701" - Delink document with ID 701

query.description: Target user ID to get assigned assets for

request.description:
Get all assets assigned to a specific user.

**Query Parameters:**
- targetUserId: Target user ID ({{targetUserId}}) - Required

**Response:** Returns a list of all assets (and other entities) assigned to the target user.

query.description: Asset ID to get link information for (optional)
Component ID to get link information for (optional)

request.description:
Get link information for a single asset or component.

**Query Parameters:**
- assetId: Asset ID ({{assetId}}) - Optional, provide either assetId or componentId
- componentId: Component ID ({{componentId}}) - Optional, provide either assetId or componentId

**Note:** At least one of assetId or componentId must be provided.

query.description: SubCategory ID to get users for

request.description:
Get all users linked to assets in a specific subcategory.

**Query Parameters:**
- subCategoryId: SubCategory ID ({{subCategoryId}}) - Required

**Response:** Returns a list of users who have assets assigned in the specified subcategory.

Create a new warranty record for an asset or component.

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: User ID ({{userId}}) - Required
- username: Username ({{username}}) - Required
- projectType: Project type ({{projectType}}) - Optional
- assetId: Asset ID ({{assetId}}) - Required
- componentId: Component ID ({{componentId}}) - Optional
- warrantyStatus: Warranty status ({{warrantyStatus}}) - Required
- warrantyProvider: Warranty provider name ({{warrantyProvider}}) - Optional
- warrantyTerms: Warranty terms description ({{warrantyTerms}}) - Optional
- startDate: Warranty start date ({{startDate}}) - Required, format: yyyy-MM-dd
- endDate: Warranty end date ({{endDate}}) - Required, format: yyyy-MM-dd
- documentId: Document ID for warranty document ({{documentId}}) - Optional
- docType: Document type ({{docType}}) - Optional

**Note:** Document uploads are handled separately via DocumentController.

Update an existing warranty record.

**Path Parameters:**
- warrantyId: Warranty ID ({{warrantyId}}) - Required

**Request Body Variables:**
Same as Create Warranty. All fields are optional for update, but provide the fields you want to update.

Soft delete a warranty record.

**Path Parameters:**
- warrantyId: Warranty ID ({{warrantyId}}) - Required

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: User ID ({{userId}}) - Required
- username: Username ({{username}}) - Required
- projectType: Project type ({{projectType}}) - Optional

**Note:** This performs a soft delete, marking the warranty as inactive rather than removing it from the database.

Get all warranty records.

**Response:** Returns a list of all warranty records with their details.

Get a specific warranty record by ID.

**Path Parameters:**
- warrantyId: Warranty ID ({{warrantyId}}) - Required

**Response:** Returns warranty details if found, 404 if not found.

Create a new AMC (Annual Maintenance Contract) record for an asset or component.

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: User ID ({{userId}}) - Optional
- username: Username ({{username}}) - Optional
- projectType: Project type ({{projectType}}) - Optional
- assetId: Asset ID ({{assetId}}) - Optional
- componentId: Component ID ({{componentId}}) - Optional
- amcStatus: AMC status ({{amcStatus}}) - Optional
- startDate: AMC start date ({{startDate}}) - Optional, format: yyyy-MM-dd
- endDate: AMC end date ({{endDate}}) - Optional, format: yyyy-MM-dd
- documentId: Document ID for AMC document ({{documentId}}) - Optional
- docType: Document type ({{docType}}) - Optional

**Note:** Document uploads are handled separately via DocumentController.

Update an existing AMC record.

**Path Parameters:**
- amcId: AMC ID ({{amcId}}) - Required

**Request Body Variables:**
Same as Create AMC. All fields are optional for update, but provide the fields you want to update.

Soft delete an AMC record.

**Path Parameters:**
- amcId: AMC ID ({{amcId}}) - Required

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: User ID ({{userId}}) - Optional
- username: Username ({{username}}) - Optional
- projectType: Project type ({{projectType}}) - Optional

**Note:** This performs a soft delete, marking the AMC as inactive rather than removing it from the database.

Get all AMC records.

**Response:** Returns a list of all AMC records with their details.

Get a specific AMC record by ID.

**Path Parameters:**
- amcId: AMC ID ({{amcId}}) - Required

**Response:** Returns AMC details if found, 404 if not found.
